Dictionary of example learning tasks

Source: R/mlr_tasks.R
mlr_tasks.Rd

Dictionary of example learning tasks

Usage

See Dictionary.

See also

Other Dictionary: Dictionary, mlr_learners, mlr_measures, mlr_resamplings

Other Task: TaskClassif, TaskRegr, TaskSupervised, Task

Examples

mlr_tasks$keys()
#> [1] "bh"    "iris"  "pima"  "sonar" "spam"  "zoo"  
as.data.table(mlr_tasks)
#>       id    type nrow ncol
#> 1:    bh    regr  506   19
#> 2:  iris classif  150    5
#> 3:  pima classif  768    9
#> 4: sonar classif  208   61
#> 5:  spam classif 4601   58
#> 6:   zoo classif  101   17
mlr_tasks$get("iris")
#> Task 'iris' of type classif (150 x 5)
#> Target: Species
#> Features: Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width
#> 
#> Public: all_classes, backend, cbind, class_n, class_names, clone,
#>   col_info, col_roles, data, feature_names, feature_types, filter,
#>   formula, hash, head, id, levels, measures, ncol, negative, nrow,
#>   positive, properties, rbind, row_ids, row_roles, select,
#>   set_col_role, set_row_role, target_names, task_type, truth
head(mlr_tasks$get("iris")$data())
#>    Species Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width
#> 1:  setosa          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2
#> 2:  setosa          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2
#> 3:  setosa          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2
#> 4:  setosa          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2
#> 5:  setosa          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2
#> 6:  setosa          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4

# Add a new task, based on a subset of iris:
data = iris
data$Species = ifelse(data$Species == "setosa", "1", "0")
b = DataBackendDataTable$new(data)
task = TaskClassif$new("iris.binary", b, target = "Species")
#> Setting positive class to '0'
mlr_tasks$add("iris.binary", task)
mlr_tasks$keys()
#> [1] "bh"          "iris"        "iris.binary" "pima"        "sonar"      
#> [6] "spam"        "zoo"        
mlr_tasks$get("iris.binary")
#> Task 'iris.binary' of type classif (150 x 5)
#> Target: Species
#> Features: Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width
#> 
#> Public: all_classes, backend, cbind, class_n, class_names, clone,
#>   col_info, col_roles, data, feature_names, feature_types, filter,
#>   formula, hash, head, id, levels, measures, ncol, negative, nrow,
#>   positive, properties, rbind, row_ids, row_roles, select,
#>   set_col_role, set_row_role, target_names, task_type, truth
mlr_tasks$remove("iris.binary")
